intro: Tigridia mexicana subsp. lilacina, commonly known as the lilac tigerflower, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its showy, brightly colored flowers that resemble those of the tiger lily. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which can be pink, red, or lilac in color, bloom in the summer months. Tigridia mexicana subsp. lilacina is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained conditions.
